text: I lose it all the time and have to flip to somewhere with a light background to find it
same here. I’ve gotten better with keyboard shortcuts because  the keyboard is the only way to easily hop around a css file when the cursor is basially in stealth mode
Heads up it appears the follow me module is affected by caching. there’s a long delay after adding an account to show in the module
Thank you for pointing this out.
if anyone else is experiencing this I found a way to bruteforce it. update a page on the site and publish. forces it to update
What do you think is a reasonable amount of time for it to cache?

well, I understand the need for it to cache, maybe a better solution is to tell the user when updating the follow me settings that it will take under x minutes to become live. and perhaps add a force-live button. 

Though honestly most people would probably hit the force live button.

The problem we had is we have a pretty tech savvy guy who tried updating the follow me, and undid what he did assuming he was doing it wrong since his changes didn’t appear to take.

So if it can’t be within a minute or two from updating, at a minimum it should state how long until it will go live.
Looks like it’s cached for 15 minutes right now
I made an issue for us to look at automatically expiring pages that include the module
Syntax highlighting on *unless statements* seems to be missing. It doesn’t go orange like _if_ or _for_ statements. Is that by design?
<@U3T21PDBK> Thanks for reporting this. We will get this cleaned up!
